introduction: Since 2016, Hodl Hodl's LEND platform offers global, non‐custodial P2P Bitcoin-backed loans using multisig escrow. Borrowers and lenders set their own terms—anonymous, self-custody, no KYC required.
highlights: Core vulnerability is the closed-source wallet that generates the borrower's key directly in the browser, creating a wide attack surface. Open-sourcing that code (or letting users bring their own key) would close the main gap.

custody.note: 2‑of‑3 on‑chain multisig. Borrower and lender each hold a key; Hodl  Hodl holds the third only for dispute resolution. Counterparty cooperation needed, but no centralized custodian.

security_governance.note: Borrower keys are generated in-browser by closed-source JS; no audits exist. Full unilateral sweep risk.

oracle.note: Hodl Hodl uses an internal oracle by Hodlex Ltd, calculating prices as the median from major exchanges like Binance, Kraken, KuCoin, Coinbase, Bitfinex, ByBit, OKX, Huobi, Bitstamp, Gemini, Bittrex, Bitrue, MEXC, HitBTC, BitMart, Compound, BKEX, Cryptology.

liquidation_buffer.note: 20% buffer with margin calls at 75%, 80%, and 85%. No grace window. Max LTV is 70%, with forced liquidation at 90% after three warning emails.

rate_and_term.note: Interest is fixed for the whole period and lender funds are locked in escrow (duration-matched).

transparency.note: Collateral UTXOs are public, but backend code and liability data are closed; only a standalone open-source "doomsday" tool is published.

loan_currency.note: The lender offers several payout options, including USDT (ERC-20, TRC-20, Omni, Liquid), USDC (ERC-20, TRC-20), USDP (ERC-20), DAI (ERC-20), L-BTC (Liquid), and wBTC (ERC-20).

privacy.note: No KYC; only e-mail is required; platform markets itself as "Anonymous – No verification required.".

history.note: One minor 2021 incident—forced liquidation after potential payment-password leak; users compensated.

jurisdiction.note: Hodlex Ltd – limited liability company incorporated under the laws of Marshall Islands.
